title: The (Inca) empire strikes back
caption: The (Inca) empire strikes back
desc: Back in the 1530s, Spanish conquistadors were tightening their grip on the lands of the Incan Empire, including the massive 12th-century stone fortress in today's image: Sacsayhuamán, in the old Inca capital of Cusco. The Spanish held a man named Manco Inca prisoner, the puppet leader they installed over the Incans. But one day in the spring of 1536, he escaped.
copyright: Inca fortress of Sacsayhuamán near Cusco, Peru (© Susanne Kremer/eStock Photo)
